data.description:
Homebrew Reference Book: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Droids

Template Type: Droid Templates

Some Droids have state-of-the-art systems and cutting-edge technology incorporated into their designs.

An Advanced Droid is able to have two modifications from the Tech Specialist or Superior Tech Feats, instead of just one. The Advanced Droid's Damage Threshold is increased by 5, and its movement speed increases by 1. The sale price for Advanced Droids is at least double the stock price of a standard model. The repair and maintenance costs associated with an Advanced Droid are doubled, and any repair DCs are increased by 5.

Homebrew Reference Book: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Droids

Template Type: Droid Templates

Although rare, some Droids remain in service after thousands of years. Even though they remain functional, Archaic Droids are generally inferior to their modern-day counterparts.

An Archaic Droid can be obtained for 50% of the cost for a current model, but has its Damage Threshold lowered by 5. The DC for all Mechanics and Use Computer checks used to repair the Archaic Droid are increased by 10. Additionally, any built-in weaponry on an Archaic Droid is incapable of scoring a Critical Hit against non-archaic Droids and equipment.

Homebrew Reference Book: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Droids

Template Type: Droid Templates

Droids that have been cobbled together with inferior parts, or that have been denied routine maintenance over an extended period of time can be considered Junk Droids.

A Junk Droid has its Damage Threshold reduced by 5, and must develop a quirk (See Droid Quirks) each time the Droid takes damage that exceeds its Damage Threshold. The DC of the skill check associated with repairing that quirk is also reduced by 5, and the repair costs are reduced by 50%.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Weapon

Prototype items are unstable and not ready for release to the general public, but they might have properties that other items do not.

Weapons: A Prototype Weapon can have two Modifications from the Tech Specialist Feat instead of just one. However, a Prototype Weapon treats a natural roll of 1, 2, 3, or 4 as though it were a Natural 1 (Thus, automatically missing), and the Prototype Weapon becomes disabled until it is repaired.

Armors: A suit of Prototype Armor can have two Modifications from the Tech Specialist Feat instead of just one. However, a wearer of Prototype Armor takes 1 more die of damage from a Critical Hit (Before multiplying); thus, a Heavy Blaster Pistol that scores a Critical Hit against a target wearing Prototype Armor deals 4d8 base damage, which is then doubled.

Homebrew Prototype Droids[edit | edit source]

Homebrew Reference Book: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Droids

The Prototype General Template is expanded to include Droids in its use.

A Prototype Droid can have two modifications from the Tech Specialist or Superior Tech Feats, instead of just one. However, the Droid inherits a permanent quirk (See Droid Quirks), its Damage Threshold is reduced by 25%, and a roll of Natural 1 is always considered an automatic failure for both skill checks and attack rolls. The inherent quirks of the Prototype Droid cannot be removed unless one of the benefits of the Prototype General Template is also removed.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: The Baragwin (Species)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Weapon

Weapons manufactured by the Baragwin can be nasty, because the Species has perfected the creation of deadly Weapons through centuries of serving as galactic arms dealers.

Weapons: On a successful Critical Hit, Baragwin Manufacture Weapons grant their wielders +1 die of damage (After multiplying for the Critical Hit). However, Baragwin Manufacture Weapons are considered Illegal.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: The Bothan (Species)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Weapon with an Ion or Stun Setting

Bothan society is well known for its penchant for espionage, and the Bothans have developed methods of subduing targets without killing them.

Weapons: Bothan Manufacture Weapons deal +1 die of damage when set to Stun or when dealing Ion damage, but deal -1 die of damage when not set to Stun or dealing Ion damage.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: The Dashade (Species)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Weapon

The Dashade Species specializes in creating Weapons capable of inflicting great pain- if not great damage- upon an opponent.

Weapons: A target moved down the Condition Track by an attack from a Dashade Manufacture Weapon can only spend 2 Swift Actions per turn to Recover. This effect lasts until the target return to it's normal state (All conditions removed). Dashade Manufacture Weapons are considered Illegal, and take a -2 penalty to damage rolls.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: The Gand (Species)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Weapon with a Stun Setting

The Gand Species, peculiar and often incomprehensible, specializes in crafting Weapons that immobilizes opponents.

Weapons: If a Gand Manufacture Weapon moves a target down the Condition Track with it's Stun damage, that target has it's speed halved until it returns to it's normal state (All conditions removed); a target that is -4 steps down the Condition Track (At the -10 step) is Immobilized instead. Gand Manufacture Weapons are difficult to operate, and all Gand Manufacture Weapons are considered Exotic Weapons for purposes of proficiency (Except to a member of the Gand Species).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 10% credits more than base item

Applicable To: Any Weapon

These Quick Draw Weapons are specially designed to be pulled quickly, whether by modification to the Weapon or to it's holster.

Weapons: A Quick Draw Weapon wielder that posses the Quick Draw Feat can draw or holster the Weapon once per round as a Free Action.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: The Infinite Empire

Cost: 30% or 3,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Weapon

Crafted by an ancient and extremely advanced Species known as the Rakata, Weapons with this Weapon Template are powerful and extremely alien to modern Species.

Weapons: Rakatan Manufacture Weapons increase their die type by one step (From d4 to d6, d6 to d8, d8 to d10, or d10 to a maximum of d12) and grant the wielder a +1 Equipment bonus on attack rolls. Rakatan Manufacture Weapons are considered Exotic Weapons for purposes of proficiency (Except to a member of the Rakata Species).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: The Sith (Force Tradition)

Cost: 20% or 2,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Advanced Melee Weapon or Simple Weapon (Melee)

Sith Alchemical Weapons are items that have undergone an arcane enhancement process using ancient Sith techniques. Favored by The Sith in the days prior to the spread of Lightsabers, Sith Alchemical Weapons are not only resistant to damage but also channel The Dark Side through them. Ancient Sith Lords used Sith Alchemy to fundamentally alter the chemical makeup of their Weapons, resulting in something far more dangerous than the typical War Sword or Vibro-Axe.

Weapons: A Lightsaber does not ignore a Sith Alchemical Weapon's Damage Reduction, and the characters who are proficient with the Sith Alchemical Weapon can treat it as a Lightsaber for the purpose of using the Block, Deflect, and Redirect Shot Talents (As well as any Talents that have those Talents as a prerequisite).

Additionally, a Sith Alchemical Weapon becomes more powerful in the hands of a character who is steeped in the in the Dark Side of The Force. A character proficient with a Sith Alchemical Weapon can spend a Force Point as a Swift Action to gain a bonus to damage rolls with the Sith Alchemical Weapon equal to his or her Dark Side Score. This bonus to damage applies to the next attack made with the Sith Alchemical Weapon before the end of the encounter, and activating this ability increases the wielder's Dark Side Score by 1.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

This Weapon Template can be applied to any weapon that doesn't appear in the Saga Edition Core Rulebook and represents pre-Legacy era technology. Most Antiquated Weapons are still fully functional but do not take advantage of the latest technological advancements.

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 10% credits more than base item

Applicable To: Any pre-Legacy era Powered Weapon, not including Weapons found in the Star Wars Saga Edition Core Rulebook

Availability: All Antiquated Weapons gain the Rare availability, if they do not already have it.

Energy Cells and Power Packs: Antiquated Energy Cells and Antiquated Power Packs for Antiquated Weapons cost 50% more than a standard Energy Cell or Power Pack. Unless otherwise specified, an Antiquated Weapon cannot use standard Energy Cells or Power Packs, only Antiquated Energy Cells or Antiquated Power Packs.

Repairs: Antiquated Weapons do not use modern technology and are likely to be unfamiliar to most weaponsmiths. An Antiquated Weapon increases the base DC of any Mechanics check made to build or repair the Weapon by +5.

Refitting: An Antiquated Weapon can be Refitted. Apply the Refitted Weapon Template to the base Weapon instead of the Antiquated Weapon Template.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

Template Type: Weapon Templates

When a character Refits an Antiquated Weapon, he or she upgrades its interchangeable parts with components that use the latest advances in weapon technology. Refitted Weapons have the following changes to their statistics:

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 20% credits more than base item

Applicable To: Any Weapon with the Antiqued Weapon Template

Availability: All Refitted Weapons gain the Rare availability, if they do not already have it.

Energy Cell: A Refitted Weapon can use standard Energy Cells and Power Packs. Additionally, weapons that use Power Packs to provide ammunition have their number of shots that can be fired before the Power Pack must be replaced increased by 10%.

Repairs: Since Refitted Weapons combine Antiqued technology with modern components, sometimes the Weapon must be treated gently and repairs can be challenging. A Refitted Weapon increases the base DC of any Mechanics check made to build or repair the Weapon by +5.

Maintenance: Unlike normal Weapons, Refitted Weapons require extra maintenance to ensure that they continue to function as expected. Once per week the Weapon must receive regular maintenance, which requires 1 hour or work (No Mechanics check required, though a Tool Kit is necessary to perform the maintenance). Failure to perform this maintenance move the Weapon -1 Persistent step down the Condition Track for each day it does not receive maintenance after one week.

Homebrew Reference Book: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Grand Army of the Republic (Part 2)

Template Type: Weapon Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Applicable To: Any Ranged Weapon dealing Piercing damage

Slugthrowers, Shatterguns, and other projectile weapons often have their barrels and stocks removed by those wishing to more easily conceal them.

Weapons: A Sawed-Off Weapon reduces its size category one step, but also reduces its Range by half.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Threats of the Galaxy

Template Type: Armor Templates

Manufactured By: The Mandalorians (Organization)

Cost: 30,000 credits more than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor

Mandalorian Armor is constructed of a rare iron alloy, favored for its strength and durability, as well as its ability to turn away Lightsaber attacks. The Mandalorians guard the secret of producing Armor made from this material, making it especially rare in the galaxy.

The Mandalorian Armor Template is typically applied to Battle Armor or Heavy Battle Armor.

Armor: A Suit of Armor with the Mandalorian Armor Template has it's Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense increase by +1. Additionally, if the wearer has Damage Reduction, they can apply it's benefit against attacks made by Lightsabers. In some eras, particularly during the Mandalorian Wars, the Armor alone grants favorable circumstances on Persuasion checks made to Intimidate.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Armor Templates

Manufactured By: Bonadan (Planet)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor that provides an Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense

Although Weapons are Illegal on the crowded world of Bonadan, Armor crafted from a unique alloy created on the planet is second to none.

Armor: Bonadan-Alloy Armor provides Damage Reduction 2 against Slashing damage, but any Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense provided by the Armor is reduced by one (To a minimum of +0).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Armor Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor

An extremely solid and durable metal, Bronzium can be used in the production of Armor that can protect the wearer from suffering great harm.

Armor: Once per encounter, the wearer of a suit of Bronzium Cast Armor can redirect the damage from a successful incoming attack to the Armor; the Bronzium Cast Armor takes the damage from the attack (Armor has the same DR, Hit Points, Damage Threshold, and break DC as a Weapon of the same size category as the wearer (See Attack an Object)). If the Bronzium Cast Armor is disabled or destroyed, it no longer provides any bonuses to the wearer. A suit of Armor pushed down the Condition Track imposes it's condition penalties to the wearer's Reflex Defense only.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Armor Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor that provides an Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense

A thin and lightweight metal, Durasteel is used in the construction of Armor when extra protection is needed.

Armor: Durasteel Cast Armor grants Damage Reduction 1 to the wearer, but any Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense provided by the Armor is reduced by one (To a minimum of +0).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Armor Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor that provides an Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense

Environmental Bastion Armors are designed to protect the wearer from harsh environments- including Vacuum- and provide a comfortable environment for whatever Species they are made for (For example, Ubese wear Environmental Bastion Armor that produces atmosphere similar to their homeworld's).

Armor: Environmental Bastion Armor acts as a sealed Space Suit, providing a number of hours of breathable air to the wielder equal to the Armor's Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: Armor Templates

Manufactured By: Eriadu (Planet)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor that provides an Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense

Crafted on the Human-dominated world of Eriadu, Eriadun Armor helps soldiers avoid being taken prisoner and interrogated by enemy forces.

Armor: A suit of Eriadu Armor or an Eriadu Energy Shield provides Damage Reduction 5 against Stun damage, but any Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense provided by the Armor is reduced by one (To a minimum of +0).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Rebellion Era Campaign Guide

Template Type: Armor Templates

Manufactured By: The Galactic Empire (Organization) and The Mandalorians (Organization)

Cost: 20% more than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor

Harder and more durable than standard Plastoid, Stygian-Triprismatic Polymer is used in the manufacture of Blackhole Stormtrooper Armor and some types of Mandalorian Armor.

Armor: A Suit of Armor possessing the Stygian-Triprismatic Polymer Armor Template increase its Equipment bonus to Reflex Defense by +1, as well as granting a +2 Equipment bonus to Stealth checks to avoid being detected be electronic sensors.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Starships of the Galaxy

Template Type: Vehicle Templates

Cost: Advanced Vehicles are normally cutting-edge prototypes with project costs easily reaching millions of credits.

An Advanced Vehicle is on the cutting edge of technology, one that includes numerous new systems and improvements to old systems. Individual prototypes of new ship classes, specially modified private vessels for the rich and powerful, and special ships built by cultures that have particularly advanced technology are all represented by adding this template to standard Starships.

Advanced Vehicles are rarely a class of vessel. Even the most cutting-edge culture can't make more than a few of these vessels at a time. They require regular maintenance (Taking 1 day and a DC 30 Mechanics check each week) or move -1 Persistent step on the Condition Track until missed Mechanics checks are made.

Modifications[edit | edit source]

To create an Advanced Vehicle, make the following changes to an existing Starship:

  • Challenge Level (CL): The CL of an Advanced Vehicle is 125% of it's normal value (Rounded up).
  • Shield Rating (SR): Increase the ship's SR by an amount based on its size; Huge +5, Gargantuan +10, Colossal +20, Colossal (Frigate) +30, Colossal (Cruiser) +40, Colossal (Station) +50. If the base ship doesn't have Starship Shields normally, give it shields with a total SR of double the given bonus +10.
  • Hit Points: Increase the ship's total Hit Points by 25% (Rounded up).
  • Strength: Increase the ship's Strength by the following bonus based on its size; Huge +2, Gargantuan +6, Colossal +10, Colossal (Frigate) +16, Colossal (Cruiser) +22, Colossal (Station) +36. Increase the ship's Fortitude Defense, Damage Threshold, and Grapple modifier to represent the new Strength modifier.
  • Dexterity: Increase the Dexterity of Huge and Gargantuan Starships by 8, Colossal (Station) ships by 2, and all others by 4. Increase the ship's Initiative, Reflex Defense, and Pilot check modifier to represent the new Dexterity modifier.
  • Intelligence: Increase the ship's Intelligence by 4. Increase your weapon attack bonuses to represent your new Intelligence modifier.
  • Weapon Systems: Increase the damage dealt by all Weapon Systems by 1 die.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Starships of the Galaxy

Template Type: Vehicle Templates

Cost: Archaic Vehicles generally can be obtained on the Black Market for 50% of their original cost.

An Archaic Vehicle is one from a much earlier era of technology. Despite potentially having all the same basic technology as modern vessels (Laser Cannons, Starship Shields, Hyperdrives, and so on), an Archaic Vehicle suffers some disadvantages when facing vessels from higher levels of technology. The Archaic Vehicle Template can also be used to represent a Starship built by a culture whose technology is less developed than the galactic norm.

Even extremely ancient Starships can be sufficiently upgraded that they no longer suffer the disadvantages of the Archaic Vehicle Template. This requires 1 week of work x the Vehicle's cost modifier (See Starship Modifications), and credits equal to 1/10 the ship's original cost. For each week of work, you must succeed on a DC 25 Mechanics check, or that week's effort is lost. If multiple characters work on upgrading an Archaic Vehicle, divide the total time required by the number of characters who succeed on the Mechanics check.

Modifications[edit | edit source]

All the modifications for the Archaic Vehicle Template apply only when the ship is in combat with modern Starships. If two Archaic Vehicles engage in combat, ignore all changes made by this template.

  • Challenge Level (CL): The CL of an Archaic Vehicle is 2/3 it's normal value (Rounded up).
  • Damage Threshold: Against modern weapons, an Archaic Vehicle has only half it's normal Damage Threshold.
  • Shield Rating (SR): Any time the SR value of an Archaic Vehicle is exceeded, there is a 50% chance they fail entirely. They may be recharged normally (Using the Recharge Shields Action).
  • Weapon Systems: The Weapon Systems of an Archaic Vehicle can't score Critical Hits against nonarchaic vessels.
    • All attack rolls made by Archaic Vehicles against modern vessels take a -2 penalty, since older scanners have difficulty tracking modern ships.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Starships of the Galaxy

Template Type: Vehicle Templates

The Junker Vehicle Template represents Starships (Most often Starfighters and Space Transports, though a Junker Capital Ship is certainly possible) that are badly put together. Many Junkers are older Starships that haven't been properly maintained for so long that it's simply not possible to bring them back to fully functional status. Junkers can also represent ships that are poorly designed, making them Junkers right off the assembly line.

Junkers can also be used to represent "Uglies," Starships constructed from parts of different ship designs. The most common Uglies are TYE-Wings, which combine the ball cockpit of a TIE Fighter with the engines of a Y-Wing. TYE-Wings are slower than TIE Fighters and lack the increased durability of Y-Wings, but because spare parts for those two models are so common, combining them into clunky, Ugly Starfighters sometimes makes sense.

Modifications[edit | edit source]

To create a Junker Vehicle, make the following changes to an existing Vehicle:

  • Challenge Level (CL): Reduce the CL of a Junker by 20% (Rounded down).
  • Initiative: Reduce a Junker's Initiative by 5 after all other modifications.
  • Abilities: Reduce a Junker's Strength by 4, and it's Dexterity and Intelligence by 2 (To a minimum of 10 each). Recalculate all statistics derived from these Abilities' modifiers.
  • System Failures: A Junker is always on the verge of falling apart, and sometimes does so in the middle of combat. Every time a Junker moves down the Condition Track, one of it's systems fail. A failed system is totally nonfunctional and remains that way until the Junker moves back up the Condition Track. Roll percentage dice to see what system fails (See below). If you roll a system your Junker does not have (Such as rolling a Hyperdrive malfunction on a ship lacking a Hyperdrive), simply ignore the result- you got lucky.
D% FAILED SYSTEM
01-30 Hyperdrive
31-60 Engines (Reduce Starship Scale Speed by 1 square, and Character Scale movement by the same percentage)
61-85 One Weapon System or Weapon Battery (Determine which randomly)
86-95 Computer Core (-5 to all Perception and Use Computer checks made with the Starship's equipment)
96-100 Starship Shields
  • Patchwork: The one benefit of a Junker is that it's clobbered-together systems are easier to patch back together into the semifunctional state they normally operate in. Reduce the DC of any Mechanics check made on a Junker by 2.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Starships of the Galaxy

Template Type: Vehicle Templates

The Prototype Vehicle Template represents the model of a Starship that is used to find any hidden flaws and test new systems before the Starship goes into production. A Prototype Vehicle is lovingly hand-built by teams of engineers, since no mass-production line exists to churn it out yet. Some classes of ships are always built as Prototypes, and then have the Prototype Vehicle Template removed as a final construction stage.

The Prototype Vehicle Template can also be used to represent a unique ship built by a small group that has no intention of ever turning it into a mass-produced Starship. Some pirates and rich traders have custom ships hand-crafted for their use, and occasionally a ship is so extensively rebuilt that it qualifies as a Prototype of a new class of ship. Some Alliance Capital Ships built from older vessels fall into this category.

A ship can have the Prototype Vehicle Template removed by a massive overhaul that reengineers all it's systems to normal tolerances. This is a time-consuming and expensive proposition. It has a base cost of 50,000 credits modified by the Starship's Cost Modifier based on Size, and takes 1 day per 5,000 credits of that cost.

 Modifications[edit | edit source]

To create a Prototype Vehicle, make the following changes to an existing Vehicle:

  • Damage Threshold: A Prototype Vehicle isn't quite as resistant to incoming damage, since it doesn't have the benefit of being redesigned after every bad design element has been discovered. Lower it's Damage Threshold by an amount equal to its Size Modifier (-1 Large, -2 Huge, -5 Gargantuan, -10 Colossal or Larger).
  • Abilities: Increase the Prototype's Strength, Dexterity, and Intelligence by 2. Prototypes have the advantage of having their systems double-checked, fine-tuned, and carefully recalibrated, and they enjoy a level of precision engineering impossible to maintain on a production line. Recalculate all statistics derived from these Abilities' modifiers.
  • Speed: The careful tuning of a Prototype's engines gives it a +1-Square bonus to Starship Scale movement.
  • Random Benefit/Drawback: A Prototype always has at least one Benefit and one Drawback over standard Starships of its class, which are lost in mass production. (Some Prototypes have two Benefits and Drawbacks.) Roll twice randomly to see which statistic increases and which is reduced (You can't have a Benefit and Drawback in the same category):
RESULT AFFECTED STATISTIC BENEFIT DRAWBACK
1-2 Starship Armor +2 -2
3-4 Maximum Hit Points +10% -10%
5-6 Shield Rating +25% -25%
7-8 Speed (Starship Scale) +1 Square -1 Square
9-10 Required Crew -70% +30%
11-12 Maximum Passengers +50% -50%
13-14 Cargo Capacity +50% -50%
15-16 Carried Craft +25% (Minimum 1 Starfighter) -25% (Minimum 1 Starfighter)
17-18 Weapon System +1 Weapon System -1 Weapon System
19-20 Reroll - -
  • Maintenance Requirement: A Prototype Vehicle manages to maintain it's high precision tuning only if it is regularly given good maintenance. A Prototype Vehicle requires 8 hours of maintenance a month and a DC 20 Mechanics check to keep it running smoothly. If the maintenance isn't kept up, or the Mechanics check for doing so fails, the Prototype Vehicle loses it's +2 Ability increases and it's random Benefit (But not it's random Drawback), and moves -1 step down the Condition Track.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

Template Type: Vehicle Templates

Antiquated Vehicles are relics from recent history; maybe a few of these Vehicles can be seen plying the space lanes, but many are either novelties or Vehicles that are barely holding themselves together. While not so old as to be called archaic, these Vehicles have not rolled off the assembly lines in a long while.

Modifications[edit | edit source]

To create a Antiquated Vehicle, make the following changes to an existing Vehicle:

  • Challenge Level (CL): Reduce the base Vehicle's CL by -2.
  • Damage Threshold: An Antiquated Vehicle's superstructure lacks many of the advancements that hold the Vehicle together when stuck by modern weapons fire. Reduce the Vehicle's Damage Threshold by 25%.
  • Base Attack Bonus: An Antiquated Vehicle lacks updates to sensors that overcome modern Vehicles' defensive countermeasures. Apply a -2 penalty to the Vehicle's Base Attack Bonus and all attacks made with its Weapon Systems.
  • Availability: All Antiquated Vehicles gain the Rare Availability, if they do not already have it.
  • Cost: Antiquated Vehicles are only available at their Used sale price. If an Antiquated Vehicle does not have a Used sale price, calculate it as 60% of the original cost. All Antiquated Vehicles are considered to be Used.
  • Repairs: Antiquated Vehicles do not use modern technology and are likely to be unfamiliar to most ship engineers. The base DC of any Mechanics checks made to Build Object or Repair increase by +5 when associated with an Antiquated Vehicle.
  • Refitting: An Antiquated Vehicle can be Refitted. Apply the Refitted Vehicle Template to the base Vehicle instead of the Antiquated Vehicle Template.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

Template Type: Vehicle Templates

Used to represent everything from Yuuzhan Vong Vehicles to the spacecraft of Zonama Sekot, the Living Vehicle Template allows you to create statistics for biological analogies of existing ships. Though the template won't present the fine mechanical tuning of designing a Vehicle from scratch, if you just need a basic Living Vehicle comparable in firepower to an X-Wing Starfighter, the Living Vehicle Template should suffice.

Modifications[edit | edit source]

To create a Living Vehicle, make the following changes to an existing Vehicle:

  • Challenge Level (CL): The CL of a Living Vehicle is equal to its normal value +2.
  • Shield Rating: Typically, the SR of a Living Vehicle does not represent traditional shields but some other form of damage absorption. Yuuzhan Vong Vehicles use Dovin Basals to help negate damage. A Living Vehicle's SR is not reduced by a single attack, even if it exceeds the ship's current SR. A Weapon System set to Autofire, however, reduces the Living Vehicle's SR as normal if the Autofire attack's damage exceeds the Living Vehicle's SR.
  • Hit Points: Unlike a normal Vehicle, Mechanics checks cannot be made to Repair Hit Point damage to a Living Vehicle. The Treat Injury skill can be used to Repair the Living Vehicle's lost Hit Points.
  • Natural Healing: A Living Vehicle regains a number of Hit Points per day on it's own equal to one-half it's Fortitude Defense. These Hit Points are only regained when the Living Vehicle is unused for 8 hours.
  • Dovin Basals: Yuuzhan Vong Vehicles have Dovin Basals, small organisms that generate tiny black holes that can be used for special attacks. A Dovin Basal has the same Range as a Blaster Cannon, but cannot fire at targets at Long Range. A Dovin Basal does not deal normal Hit Point damage; instead, if the Dovin Basal's damage exceeds the target Vehicle's SR, the Vehicle's SR is reduced by 10 instead of by 5. A Dovin Basal's damage is determined by its size:
LIVING VEHICLE SIZE DOVIN BASAL DAMAGE
Colossal or Smaller 7d10x2
Colossal (Frigate) 5d10x5
Colossal (Cruiser) or Larger 7d10x5
  • Tractor Beams: Yuuzhan Vong Vehicles can use their Dovin Basals as Tractor Beams. Other kinds of Living Vehicles have comparable alternatives to emulate a Tractor Beam's effects.
  • Weapon Systems: Living Vehicles have analogues for most Weapon Systems. Weapon Systems that deal Energy damage alone typically deal Fire damage instead of normal Energy damage. Other Weapon Systems, even Ion weapons, have analogues on a Living Vehicle. They behave exactly as the Weapon System does on the base Vehicle.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

Template Type: Vehicle Templates

A Refitted Vehicle is an older model from years past that has had its internal components upgraded to take advantage of advances in modern technology. A Refitted Vehicle maintains the basic structure of the original Vehicle but has the latest and greatest parts available in the current era.

Modifications[edit | edit source]

To create a Refitted Vehicle, make the following changes to an existing Vehicle:

  • Cost: Refitted Vehicles are only available at their Used sale price, +20% for the cost of Refitting.
  • Availability: All Refitted Vehicles gain the Rare Availability, if they do not already have it.
  • Repairs: Since Refitted Vehicles combine antiquated technology with modern components, sometimes the Vehicle must be treated gently and repairs can be challenging. A Refitted Vehicle increases the base DC of any Mechanics checks made to Repair it by +5.
  • Maintenance: Unlike normal Vehicles, Refitted Vehicles must be given extra maintenance to ensure that they continue to function as expected. Once per week the Refitted Vehicle must receive regular maintenance, which requires 1 hour of work (No Mechanics check required, though a Tool Kit is necessary to perform the maintenance). Failure to perform this maintenance moves the Refitted Vehicle -1 Persistent step down the Condition Track for each day it does not receive maintenance after one week.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: Arkania (Planet)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Ranged Energy Weapon

Developed on the frozen tundra world of Arkania, weapons and armor of Arkanian Manufacture are engineered to function in extremely cold environments.

Weapons: Arkanian Manufacture Weapons deal Energy and Fire damage; however, if an Arkanian Weapon is used with an ability that consumes more than one shot in a round (Such as Rapid Shot or Double Attack), the weapon overheats and cannot be fired for one round as it cools down.

Armors: Arkanian Manufacture Armor doubles it's Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense against Extreme Cold, but has no Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense against Extreme Heat.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: Empress Teta (Planet)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Ranged Energy Weapon

Cinnagaran Manufacture items are manufactured on the sprawling metropolis world of Empress Teta, which has been at the center of galactic wars for over a thousand years.

Weapons: Cinnagaran Weapons deal both Energy and Bludgeoning damage.

Armors: Cinnagaran Manufacture Armor and Shields grant Damage Reduction 5 against weapons that deal Sonic damage, but it's Maximum Dexterity Bonus is reduced by 1.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 20% more than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Weapon

Weapons and Armor made of Cortosis Weave or Phrik Alloy share a special property that prevents Lightsabers from slicing through them with great ease.

Weapons: A Lightsaber does not ignore the Damage Reduction of a Weapon.

Armors: A Lightsaber does not ignore the Damage Reduction of a Suit of Armor.

Special: During the Knights of the Old Republic era, almost all melee weapons are coated with a Cortosis Weave due not only to an abundance of the material, but also the presence of large numbers of Lightsaber-wielding combatants; as a result, they are not given the Rare Availability tag during this era. During other eras, however, these materials are far more difficult to find, and are given the Rare tag as normal.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: The Echani (Organization)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Slashing or Piercing Weapon (Excluding Lightsabers)

Extremely rare, items of Echani Manufacture are hand-crafted by the powerful and skilled Echani warriors, and each individual item is unique.

Weapons: Once per encounter the wielder of an Echani Manufacture Weapon can declare that the critical range of their Weapon is increased by one (Thus scoring a Critical Hit on a Natural 19 or Natural 20 on most weapons). The use of this ability can be declared after the attack roll is made, but before the attack is resolved. However, Echani Manufacture Weapons have half as many Hit Points as other Weapons of their kind.

Armors: Echani Manufacture Armors weighs half as much as other Armors of it's kind, and once per encounter the wearer can move at their normal speed (Not the adjusted speed for wearing the Armor) for one round, though the Armor's bonus to Reflex Defense is reduced by 1.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: The GenoHaradan (Organization)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Melee non-Energy Weapon, Any Ranged Weapon with a Stun Setting

A secretive guild of assassins and bounty hunters, The GenoHaradan have items specially crafted to suit their darker purposes.

Weapons: GenoHaradan Manufacture Weapons grant a +2 Equipment bonus to the attack roll of a Contact Poison applied to the weapon (For Melee Weapons), or a +1 Equipment bonus on attack rolls with weapons set to Stun (For Ranged Weapons). GenoHaradan Manufactured Weapons are somewhat fragile, and become disabled until repaired when the wielder rolls a Natural 1 on an attack roll.

Armors: GenoHaradan Manufacture Armors provides a +2 Equipment bonus on Stealth checks to Sneak, but reduces the Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense by one (Minimum +0).

attributes.application: (ARMOR) OR (WEAPON AND MELEE AND !ENERGY) OR (WEAPON AND RANGED AND STUN)

data.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: The Iridonians (Species)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Weapon

The Iridonians are a mysterious Species known for their savagery and aggressiveness.

Weapons: Iridonian Manufacture Weapons gain a +2 bonus Equipment bonus to damage rolls when using either the Power Attack or Power Blast Feats. However, all Iridonian Manufacture Weapons are considered Illegal, and visibly displaying an Iridonian Manufacture Weapon always imposes unfavorable circumstances on Deception or Persuasion checks against law enforcement officers and other authority figures.

Armors: Iridonian Manufacture Armors and Shields provide Damage Reduction 2 against Bludgeoning damage. However, all Iridonian Manufacture Armors are considered Illegal, and wearing Iridonian Manufacture Armor always imposes unfavorable circumstances on Deception or Persuasion checks against law enforcement officers and other authority figures.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: The Krath (Organization)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Melee Slashing or Piercing Weapon

Items created by The Krath typically have a cruel and dangerous twist.

Weapons: If an attack roll with a Krath Manufacture Weapon equals or exceeds the target's Fortitude Defense as well as it's Reflex Defense, the target takes 1d4 damage at the beginning of it's next turn.

Armors: Krath Manufacture Armors and Shields provide Damage Reduction 2 against Energy damage.

Special: Krath Manufacture Weapons and Armor hold the taint of the Dark Side within them, and any character wielding a Krath Manufacture Weapon or wearing Krath Manufacture Armor treat their Dark Side Score as one higher than it actually is for purposes of being targeted by effects that only affect targets with a Dark Side Score.

attributes.application: (ARMOR) OR (WEAPON AND MELEE AND (SLASH OR PIERCE))

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: The Mandalorians (Organization)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Weapon

A Mandalorian warrior is made great by his or her Equipment, and each piece of Mandalorian Manufacture Equipment is unique in some way.

Effects: Mandalorian Manufacture items are made with customization in mind; any character making a Mechanics check to repair or modify a Weapon or suit of Armor of Mandalorian Manufacture gains a +5 Equipment bonus on the check. However, Mandalorian technology is often based on the designs of other cultures, causing some unusual interaction between technologies; if a Mandalorian Manufacture item is disabled, all of the Weapon and Armor Accessories to that item are destroyed (And must be purchased anew, not merely repaired).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: The Massassi (Species)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Simple Weapons (Melee)

Built by primitive creatures for use in the service of the Sith, Massassi Manufacture items are designed to take advantage of the strength of their wielders.

Weapons: When a character scores a Critical Hit with a Massassi Manufacture Weapon held in two hands, that character triples their Strength bonus to damage (Before multiplying for the Critical Hit). However, if a character does not have a sufficient Strength score (15 for Medium Weapons, 17 for Large Weapons, or 19 for Huge and bigger Weapons) then they take a -2 penalty to attack rolls with that weapon, even if they are proficient with that weapon.

Armors: Massassi Manufacture Armor allows a Critical Hit against the wearer to be turned into a normal hit once per encounter as a Reaction. However, if a character does not have a sufficient Strength score (13 for Light Armor, 15 for Medium Armor, or 17 for Heavy Armor) they take Armor Check Penalties even when proficient in the Armor type.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: N/A

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Weapon

Prototype items are unstable and not ready for release to the general public, but they might have properties that other items do not.

Weapons: A Prototype Weapon can have two Modifications from the Tech Specialist Feat instead of just one. However, a Prototype Weapon treats a natural roll of 1, 2, 3, or 4 as though it were a Natural 1 (Thus, automatically missing), and the Prototype Weapon becomes disabled until it is repaired.

Armors: A suit of Prototype Armor can have two Modifications from the Tech Specialist Feat instead of just one. However, a wearer of Prototype Armor takes 1 more die of damage from a Critical Hit (Before multiplying); thus, a Heavy Blaster Pistol that scores a Critical Hit against a target wearing Prototype Armor deals 4d8 base damage, which is then doubled.

Homebrew Prototype Droids[edit | edit source]

Homebrew Reference Book: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Droids

The Prototype General Template is expanded to include Droids in its use.

A Prototype Droid can have two modifications from the Tech Specialist or Superior Tech Feats, instead of just one. However, the Droid inherits a permanent quirk (See Droid Quirks), its Damage Threshold is reduced by 25%, and a roll of Natural 1 is always considered an automatic failure for both skill checks and attack rolls. The inherent quirks of the Prototype Droid cannot be removed unless one of the benefits of the Prototype General Template is also removed.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

Template Type: General Templates

Manufactured By: The Verpine (Species)

Cost: 10% or 1,000 credits more (Whichever is higher) than base item

Applicable To: Any Armor, Any Ranged Energy Weapon

The insectoid Verpine are technological masters who can create items with exceptional characteristics.

Weapons: As a Swift Action, a Verpine Manufactured Weapon can be switched to an Ion fire mode, changing the Weapon to deal Ion damage instead of normal damage (At the same damage dice). However, Verpine Manufactured Weapons are designed for the Verpine's unique physiology, and they require the wearer have a minimum Intelligence score of 13 to wield the Weapon properly (Otherwise, the wielder takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls with that Weapon).

Armors: Verpine Manufacture Armors and Shields provide Damage Reduction 10 against Ion damage. However, Verpine Manufactured items are designed for the Verpine's unique physiology, and they require the wearer have a minimum Dexterity score of 13 to wear the Armor effectively (Otherwise, the wearer suffers from Armor Check Penalties).
